problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure item is placed within valid coordinate bounds
        assert assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert assignments[i].y >= 0

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Enforce field consistency between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        for j in range(i + 1, 21):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            same_box: bool = assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id
            if same_box:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                not_overlap_x: bool = (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                                      (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x)
                not_overlap_y: bool = (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                                      (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)
                assert not_overlap_x or not_overlap_y

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        assert assignments[i].box_id == positions[i].box_id
        assert assignments[i].x == positions[i].x
        assert assignments[i].y == positions[i].y

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 36, "height": 72}, {"width": 98, "height": 55}, {"width": 66, "height": 53}, {"width": 60, "height": 95}, {"width": 74, "height": 50}, {"width": 84, "height": 13}, {"width": 72, "height": 1}, {"width": 95, "height": 57}, {"width": 74, "height": 53}, {"width": 66, "height": 81}, {"width": 16, "height": 72}, {"width": 91, "height": 82}, {"width": 90, "height": 19}, {"width": 68, "height": 61}, {"width": 83, "height": 80}, {"width": 99, "height": 68}, {"width": 58, "height": 95}, {"width": 88, "height": 4}, {"width": 74, "height": 13}, {"width": 68, "height": 66}]
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, 21):
        if assignments[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = assignments[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        item : Item = items[i]
        assignment : BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert assignment.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert assignment.y + item.height <= box_height
        # Ensure item is placed within valid bounds
        assert assignment.x >= 0
        assert assignment.y >= 0
        assert assignment.box_id >= 1
        assert assignment.box_id <= 20

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Enforce consistency between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        for j in range(i + 1, 21):
            # Only check items that are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Assert that the rectangles do not overlap
                # They overlap if: not (xi2 <= xj1 or xj2 <= xi1 or yi2 <= yj1 or yj2 <= yi1)
                # So we assert the negation:
                assert (assignments[i].x + items[i].width) <= assignments[j].x or \
                       (assignments[j].x + items[j].width) <= assignments[i].x or \
                       (assignments[i].y + items[i].height) <= assignments[j].y or \
                       (assignments[j].y + items[j].height) <= assignments[i].y

no_overlap(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def each_item_in_one_box(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box (already ensured by box_id bounds)
    # We enforce that every item has a valid box assignment
    for i in range(1, 21):
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 20

each_item_in_one_box(item_box_assignments)

# Consistency between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions is already enforced
# in the original constraints; we do not redefine it here.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure positions are non-negative (already constrained by Position definition)
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlap in x-direction
                x_non_overlap: bool = (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlap in y-direction
                y_non_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one direction has non-overlap (i.e., no overlap in both directions)
                assert x_non_overlap or y_non_overlap

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure non-negative coordinates
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# Leave empty, if not required.

def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis
                x_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap (i.e., rectangles do not overlap)
                assert x_not_overlap or y_not_overlap

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.
